channel.title: Posts on Blog of MaxNTV(aka vu.nguyen)
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Blog of MaxNTV(aka vu.nguyen)

item.title: Just use Dirsearch to get Critical Bug
item.description:
Discovered the Vulnerability

As a normal days, I used “Dirsearch” to scan directory of a target from a bug bounty program, I found a directory is “.svn/wc.db”. At first I didn’t know what file this was so I asked my younger brother(aka CuongN) and he said svn like git also is version control system.

After read some blog, i know that:

In SVN (Subversion), the wc.db file is part of the internal structure of a Subversion working copy. It is a SQLite database that stores metadata related to the working copy, such as information about file versions, status, properties, and the relationship between the working copy and the repository.

item.title: How I Got My First Bug Bounty (650$ for CVE-2024-6636)
item.description:
Introduction

One day, an anonymous brother asked me, “Are you interested in finding WordPress bugs?” And that’s how this CVE came to be.

The “WooCommerce - Social Login” plugin for WordPress at version <= 2.7.3 is vulnerable to the ability to create new users with an “Administrator” role. Specifically, if the register function is enabled. In that case, the newly created user will have the default role(Subscriber), but any user without authentication(unauthenticated) can change this default role to any value including “Administrator”. From there, can create a new user with “Administrator” rights with this plugin’s account registration function.
